name: AssignedCharge
comment: Represents the details of the recurring charges allocated to the subscriber.
vf short description: Represents the details of the recurring charges allocated to the subscriber.

fields.name: AssignedChargeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: AssignedChargeKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the assigned charge in ALDM. Each assigned charge key value represents a unique assigned charge.

fields.name: CurrencySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: BaseProductCatalogSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ModificationEmployeeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: AssignedBillingOfferSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SubscriberSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ChargeCodeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: AssignedChargeEffectiveDate
fields.comment: Specifies the date from which the RC rate is effective.

fields.name: ExpirationDate
fields.comment: Specifies the date on which the RC rate expires. For non-expiring rates, this attribute contains a null value.

fields.name: AssignedChargeAmount
fields.comment: Recurring charge amount. This amount can be different in case of proration, for example, mid cycle activation, suspension, and so on.

fields.name: ManualOverrideAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the rate in cases where the agreement gets a special recurring charge rate.

fields.name: ServiceReceiverTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates the service receiver type. It can be the billing arrangement, customer, account, or subscriber.Values are: B - BA C - CUSTOMER G - GROUP I - OFFER_INSTANCE K - PARTITION_KEY O - OC_CHARGE P - PAY_CHANNEL S - SUBSCRIBER U - UNIT Y - CYCLE

fields.name: ServiceReceiverId
fields.comment: Indicates the identifier of the charge receiver. For example, if the service receiver type is subscriber, the service receiver ID is the subscriber ID.

fields.name: CustomerSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PayChannelSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ProductCatalogSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PricePlanFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the current offer is a price plan.

fields.name: BillingCycleSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: AgreementSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: DynamicAttributeList
fields.comment: List of comma-separated attributes as per to the charge type. The relevant attributes and the corresponding orders are determined as per to the charge type definition in the reference area.

fields.name: FirstCycleDate
fields.comment: Indicates the close date of the cycle in which the recurring charge was activated.

fields.name: LastCycleDate
fields.comment: Indicates the close date of the cycle in which the recurring charge was expired.

fields.name: FrequencyInd
fields.comment: Specifies how frequently the RC is applied.For example:- D=Daily- M=Monthly- W=Weekly

fields.name: FrequencyMultiplierInd
fields.comment: A positive number that is used as the multiplier for the frequency. For example, if the frequency is M and the multiplier is 6, then the RC is applied once in six months.

fields.name: ChargeRate
fields.comment: Rate of the recurring charge. In most of the implementations, this attribute is available in the Dynamic Attribute itself. The name of the attribute is dependent on customization.

fields.name: BssCreationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which the record was created in the source system.

fields.name: BssModificationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was modified in the source system

fields.name: OverrideReasonFreeText
fields.comment: The reason that has been provided as free text for charge override. This reason can be used if the reason specified in the overrideReason field is not sufficient to provide the charge override.

fields.name: OverrideReasonInd
fields.comment: Specifies the reason for override or waiver. If the customer has been given a special rate by overriding the defined rate, reason associated for the new rate must be specified in this field.

fields.name: ChargeAmount
fields.comment: Recurring charge amount. This amount can be different in case of proration, for example, mid cycle activation, suspension, and so on.

fields.name: EffectiveDate
fields.comment: Specifies the date from which the RC rate is effective.

fields.name: AssignedChargeId
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the assigned charge in the source system.

fields.name: OfferInstanceId
fields.comment: Identifies the billing offer instance.

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
